update.description:
This PR introduces a new class `Inertial` that stores a `MassMatrix3` object along with a `Pose` offset that represents the pose of the center of mass reference frame relative to a base frame. This class will be a replacement for the [gazebo::physics::Inertial class](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/d34567662a9/gazebo/physics/Inertial.hh) (see issue #32).

This PR introduces the basic class components (Constructors, Get/Set, `==` operators, etc) and a function `MOI()` that returns the moment of inertia matrix rotated into the base frame. There are tests with 100% coverage (verified locally).
update.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

content.raw: I agree that `Quaterniond` and `Quaternionf` feel weird, but ign math is not the first to do this, a search for `quaterniond` shows [Eigen](https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox/classEigen_1_1Quaternion.html) and [OpenTK](http://www.opentk.com/files/doc/struct_open_t_k_1_1_quaterniond.html) for example.
content.html: I agree that Quaterniond and Quaternionf feel weird, but ign math is not the first to do this, a search for quaterniond shows Eigen and OpenTK for example.

pull_request.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

pullrequest.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

content.raw:
We could:

1. Add the new typedefs to ign-math2 and leave in the old definitions (with a comment about which one to use). 
1. Make a release of ign-math2
1. Deprecrate the old typedefs in ign-math default (will become ign-math3)
1. Remove the old typedefs in ign-math4

Simultaneously:

1. Change the types in gazebo 7 and default to use the new typedefs (I think the change will be ABI compatible).
content.html:
We could:

  1. Add the new typedefs to ign-math2 and leave in the old definitions (with a comment about which one to use).
  2. Make a release of ign-math2
  3. Deprecrate the old typedefs in ign-math default (will become ign-math3)
  4. Remove the old typedefs in ign-math4

Simultaneously:

  1. Change the types in gazebo 7 and default to use the new typedefs (I think the change will be ABI compatible).

pullrequest.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

content.raw:
I'm not even sure I like the `_d` suffix. Perhaps the most uniform would be to use capital letters for the type:

~~~
Vector3D
Vector3F
QuaternionD
QuaternionF
InertialD
InertialF
MassMatrix3D
MassMatrix3F
~~~

I'm scared of the effort to make all these changes
content.html:
I'm not even sure I like the _d suffix. Perhaps the most uniform would be to use capital letters for the type:

Vector3D
Vector3F
QuaternionD
QuaternionF
InertialD
InertialF
MassMatrix3D
MassMatrix3F

I'm scared of the effort to make all these changes

content.raw:
I don't have a strong preference either. We should be consistent though.

If you're championing `_<type>`, then can you follow up this pull request with an update to the other classes?
content.html:
I don't have a strong preference either. We should be consistent though.

If you're championing _<type>, then can you follow up this pull request with an update to the other classes?

pull_request.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

pullrequest.title: New Inertial class: MassMatrix3 with pose offset (#32)

content.raw:
I like the typedefs for classes that end in numbers (`Vector3d`, `Matrix3d`, `MassMatrix3d`), but it feels weird to just add `d` or `f` to a word ending in a letter (`Quaterniond` and `Quaternionf` look weird).

So I guess `Inertial_d` was an experiment. I can change it for consistency with `Quaternion`, but that was my reasoning behind it.
content.html:
I like the typedefs for classes that end in numbers (Vector3d, Matrix3d, MassMatrix3d), but it feels weird to just add d or f to a word ending in a letter (Quaterniond and Quaternionf look weird).

So I guess Inertial_d was an experiment. I can change it for consistency with Quaternion, but that was my reasoning behind it.
